DOC.brief_summary: This prospective randomized study perform evaluate whether replacement GnRH agonist GnRH antagonist oocyte donation recipient endometrial preparation impact pregnancy implantation rate .
DOC.brief_title: Administration GnRH Antagonist Oocyte Donation Recipients
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective randomized study undertaken January 2004 December 2007 . One hundred patient indication oocyte donation function ovary IVF without intracytoplasmatic sperm injection ( ICSI ) recruit study . After assignment IVF IVF/ICSI randomization perform 1 2 treatment group ( GnRH agonist GnRH antagonist endometrial preparation oocyte donation recipient ) use computed-generated randomization schedule assign via number sealed envelope . In program , use excess oocyte IVF voluntarily donate patient informed consent . The indication oocyte donation reduce ovarian reserve ( 59 % ) , recurrent IVF failure ( 21 % ) , premature ovarian failure ( 16 % ) , genetic anomaly ( 4 % ) . This study perform accord declaration Helsinki European Community note Good Clinical Practice trial medical product European Community ( CPMP Working Party Efficacy Medical Products , 1990 ) . Furthermore , local ethic committee approve study protocol , write informed consent obtain patient .
DOC.criteria: Age 1834 year Body mass index 1930 kg/m2 ; History regular menstrual cycle , range 2535 day No relevant systemic disease ( patient screen hepatitis B C , human immunodeficiency virus I II , syphylis , vaginal infection ) , genetic disease , severe endometriosis pelvic inflamatory disease No two previous IVF cycle ; No previous IVF cycle poor response ( less three oocyte previous IVF cycle ) severe ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome . Patients without inclusion criterion .
